amendment.description: Amendment provides $52.5 million for the Education Department's Office of Elementary and Secondary Education to be allocated to local educational agencies for Indian education programs and reduces the Forest Service general administrative account by $10 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 69 in the Congressional Record of July 13, 1995, to reduce the funds appropriated in the bill for land acquisition by $10 million and to increase funding appropriated for Indian Education by $51.5 million.

action.text: Coburn amendment (A018) modified by unanimous consent.
On agreeing to the Coburn amendment (A018) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
